moves.1. e3 d5 2. b3 Nf6 3. Bb2: This opening only works for black. My late realization cost me 2 games.
moves.3... e6 4. Nf3 Bd6 5. Bb5+ Bd7 6. Bxd7+: I like to exchange, because it earns me an extra move.
moves.6... Nbxd7 7. O-O c6 8. c4 Qc7 9. g3: protecting the h2 pawn which might have saved my game or not.
moves.9... O-O 10. cxd5 cxd5: My advance led him to open up the queen's side.
moves.11. Qc1 Rac8: I challenged his queen, surprisingly, he made that move.
moves.12. Qxc7 Rxc7 13. Na3 a6: Notice that only move that will allow my knight to be saved is knight to b1, which wouldn't be very good for my rooks.
moves.16... Rxc2 17. Rab1 dxe4 18. dxe4 Nxe4 1: He thought both his bishop and rook was protected and so did I.
moves.20. Nh4 h6 21. Rxd6 Rxb2: seeing that his rook was a goner, he decided to go for my bishop.
moves.22. Rxb2 Nxd6 23. Rd2: another one of the amazing moves. He took 15 minutes just to respond.
moves.23... g5 24. Nf3: I didn't want to lose my knight, because I was low on pawns, and I needed all the help I can get.
Seeing that checks wouldn't get anywhere, he pushed the pawn to make for my knight.
moves.29. Ne1 Nd2+ 30. Ke2: TADA! this is what earned me a draw instead of  defeat. His best moves would be knight to b3, and take the rook, but that costed him both knight and rook.
moves.30... Nxb3+ 31. Nxc2 Nxd4+ 32. Nxd4 Kg7: Locked the king in with that move.
moves.34... h5 35. Nxb4 a5 36. Nc6 a4 37. Nd4: Why did I do that? comment please
moves.39... Kf6 40. a3 Ke6 41. Nc3 f5+ 42. Ke3: If he takes knight, I get a queen.
moves.45... Kb4 46. Kd3 f4 47. gxf4 exf4 48. K: You can see this won't go anywhere, so we agreed for a draw.
